Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.625, 0.0] to position it correctly. 2. Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Draw 8 lines in the following order: a. Line 1: From point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.625, 0.0]. b. Line 2: From point [0.625, 0.0] to point [0.625, 0.75]. c. Line 3: From point [0.625, 0.75] to point [0.5417, 0.75]. d. Line 4: From point [0.5417, 0.75] to point [0.5417, 0.4167]. e. Line 5: From point [0.5417, 0.4167] to point [0.2083, 0.4167]. f. Line 6: From point [0.2083, 0.4167] to point [0.2083, 0.2083]. g. Line 7: From point [0.2083, 0.2083] to point [0.0, 0.2083]. h. Line 8: From point [0.0, 0.2083] to point [0.0, 0.0]. 4. Close the loop to complete the 2D sketch. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 7. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.625 units along the normal direction (positive Z-axis). 8. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. 9. Create a new solid body using the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" boolean operation. This completes the construction of the rectangular prism base with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.625 - Height: 0.75</description>
